title: United Way 211
provides: Connects you to local services by phone and online.
whatToExpect: You can ask for shelter, food, bills help, mental health support, and more.

title: findhelp
provides: Search for free/low-cost services by ZIP code.
whatToExpect: Search categories like housing, food, health, money, work, and more.

title: 988 Suicide & Crisis Lifeline
provides: Call/text 988 for mental health crisis support.
whatToExpect: A trained counselor will help you through the moment and next steps.

title: Start with 211 or findhelp (Shelter search)
provides: Fast way to locate shelters and housing resources by ZIP.
whatToExpect: You may need to call multiple places. Ask about eligibility, hours, and what to bring.
whatToBring: ID if available, any documents you have, medications list.

title: Start with 211 or findhelp (Food search)
provides: Find meal sites, food banks, SNAP help, and pantry hours by ZIP.
whatToExpect: Ask: 'What can I access today without an ID?'
whatToBring: Reusable bags if possible; ID if you have it.

title: Search 211 for Hygiene Resources
provides: Find showers, laundry, and hygiene supplies.
whatToExpect: Ask for shower facilities, laundry services, or hygiene kits in your area.

title: Read the Hygiene Guide
provides: Step-by-step guide for hygiene and laundry on a budget.
whatToExpect: Practical tips for staying clean using public facilities.

title: Search 211 for ID Assistance
provides: Find local programs that help with ID and document replacement.
whatToExpect: Ask for ID assistance programs or document replacement help.
whatToBring: Any proof of identity you have.

title: Read the ID Replacement Guide
provides: Steps to replace state ID, birth certificate, and Social Security card.
whatToExpect: What to gather and who to contact for document replacement.

title: Search 211 for Phone Programs
provides: Find low-cost phone and internet assistance programs.
whatToExpect: Ask about Lifeline, ACP, or other phone assistance programs.

title: Read the Phone Access Guide
provides: How to keep your phone working using Wi-Fi and charging spots.
whatToExpect: Tips for maintaining phone access on a budget.

title: Search 211 for Job Programs
provides: Find workforce centers, job training, and employment help.
whatToExpect: Ask about job training, resume help, or day labor centers.

title: Read the Microgreens Guide
provides: How to grow microgreens with minimal cost and space.
whatToExpect: Step-by-step instructions for growing edible greens in 7-14 days.

title: Build & Fix Guides (Coming Soon)
provides: Future guides for basic repairs and safe builds.
whatToExpect: Educational content for basic building and repair skills.

title: Search 211 for Safety Resources
provides: Find domestic violence support, legal aid, and safety services.
whatToExpect: Ask about domestic violence services, legal aid, or victim support.

title: Read the Personal Safety Guide
provides: Safety tips and scam avoidance strategies.
whatToExpect: Practical advice for staying safe and avoiding scams.

title: Read the Tonight Plan Guide
provides: Plan for safer sleep and shelter search for tonight.
whatToExpect: Step-by-step checklist for making a safer plan for the night.

title: Read the Food Today Guide
provides: Steps to get meals today and assemble no‑cook food.
whatToExpect: Practical tips for finding meals and putting together a day's food without cooking.

title: Read the Resume Quickstart Guide
provides: Simple resume format and interview practice steps.
whatToExpect: Create a usable resume and prepare for basic interview questions.

title: Read the Safe Income Ideas Guide
provides: Low‑cost ways to earn without high risk or scams.
whatToExpect: Choose a small job and learn safety tips for day labor and quick income.

title: Read the Basic First Aid Guide
provides: Educational basics and when to seek medical care.
whatToExpect: Basic first aid steps and clear guidance on when to get medical help.
